director.name: 威廉·肯特里奇 William Kentridge

introduction: In City Deep, the "zama zama" miners and the landscape merge into artworks hanging in the Johannesburg Art Gallery, itself built during theheyday of gold mining in Johannesburg. Wanderingthe exhibition spaces is a deeply contemplative Soho Eckstein, gazing at the artworks and into vitrines. Towards the end of the film the gallery collapses in on itself, an imagined demise of an institution in a state of increasing dereliction.
